comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Your health should be your no.1 priority as it's your true wealth, so depending on your health status, you have to plan your trading. Trading itself is flexible, you can be a short-term or long-term trader, but it doesn't matter. What matters is what you know about your trading style and how you put it into use to earn you consistent income.So, if you are such that has issues with your eyes, you might want to avoid the short-term trading that would be causing you to stare too much at the screen. While those with minimal effect could still reduce their PC's light to the lowest just as I always do. Eyewear is another good option, the recommended or shaded ones should be able to stop the blue ray that often affects the eyes.

comments.author: lewisrafael40
comments.body: Hey there! When it comes to combating Computer Vision Syndrome (CVS) while trading, a few tips can definitely help. First, make sure you have proper lighting in your trading environment. Avoid glare on your screen by positioning your monitor away from direct light sources. Secondly, take regular breaks and give your eyes some rest. Follow the 20-20-20 rule: every 20 minutes, look at something 20 feet away for 20 seconds. This helps reduce eye strain. Lastly, consider using blue light filters or glasses that can minimize the harmful effects of blue light emitted by screens. Now, about changing the background color in bingx, unfortunately, I'm not familiar with that specific platform. But you might want to explore the settings or preferences section to see if there's an option to customize the background. Happy trading!

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: After taking into note all the tips that have been given, from seeing an eye ophthalmologist, to getting a screen protector, changing your background colour, having good lightening in your space whenever you are using your computer, you also need to consider and take seriously with consuming meals, fruits and vegetables that are rich in vitamin A and good for the eyes you need to make it a habit. Salmons, oysters, sweet potatoes, broccoli are a few examples. You should also avoid engaging in habits or eating any food that has the ability to make the condition worse.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: If you've been diagnosed already or your symptoms create a great discomfort, much better to seek a professional.Otherwise, I can vouch for blue light filter glasses + night light (feature on my PC) setup. I'm prone to eye strains whenever I stare on my monitor/tab/phone in an hour or two and this setup greatly helped me - I rarely get eye strains after this. Couple times it happend are when I was already sitting for 10 hours and above.Similar to you, I wasn't fond of pure black dark themes like bingx. I'm not sure what happened but after a few weeks or so, I think I got used to it and did not mind it as much as before.

comments.author: palle11
comments.body: If you have challenges with your sight then see a health professional on it, this is simple. When it comes to the body and the organs, their efficiency is reduced by age and you need to understand this. Your age matters to how effective your eyes will be because at older age you can find it difficult reading through letters that are smaller and far from you and as you stay closer to the system while trading, it gets worsen. So you need to reduce the brightness of your computer and go to the eye doctor for prescription on eye glass that is appropriate for your eyes.
